ids_info.name: disruption
ids_info.description: Description of physics quantities of specific interest during a disruption, in particular halo currents, etc ...

disruption/global_quantities/power_ohm_h.documentation: Ohmic power in the halo region

disruption/global_quantities/power_paral.documentation: Power of the parallel heat flux in the halo region

disruption/global_quantities/power_radia.documentation: Total power radiated by electrons on impurities
Power radiated by electrons on impurities in the halo region

disruption/global_quantities/energy_ohm.documentation: Total ohmic cumulated energy (integral of the power over the disruption duration)

disruption/global_quantities/energy_ohm_.documentation: Ohmic cumulated energy (integral of the power over the disruption duration) in the halo region

disruption/global_quantities/energy_para.documentation: Cumulated parallel energy (integral of the heat flux parallel power over the disruption duration) in the halo region

disruption/global_quantities/energy_radi.documentation: Total cumulated energy (integral of the power over the disruption duration) radiated by electrons on impurities
Cumulated energy (integral of the power over the disruption duration) radiated by electrons on impurities in the halo region

disruption/global_quantities/psi_halo_bo.documentation: Poloidal flux at halo region boundary

disruption/global_quantities/phi_halo_bo.documentation: Toroidal flux at halo region boundary
Toroidal flux at halo region boundary generated by the plasma poloidal current

disruption/halo_currents.documentation: Halo currents geometry and values for a set of time slices

disruption/halo_currents/area.documentation: Set of wall areas through which there are halo currents

disruption/halo_currents/area/start_poin.documentation: Position of the start point of this area

disruption/halo_currents/area/end_point.documentation: Position of the end point of this area

disruption/halo_currents/area/current_ha.documentation: Poloidal halo current crossing through this area

disruption/halo_currents/active_wall_poi.documentation: R,Z position of the point of the plasma boundary in contact with the wall

disruption/profiles_1d.documentation: Radial profiles for a set of time slices

disruption/profiles_1d/grid/rho_tor_norm.documentation: Normalized toroidal flux coordinate. The normalizing value for rho_tor_norm, is the toroidal flux coordinate at the equilibrium boundary (LCFS or 99.x % of the LCFS in case of a fixed boundary equilibium calculation, see time_slice/boundary/b_flux_pol_norm in the equilibrium IDS)

disruption/profiles_1d/grid/rho_tor.documentation: Toroidal flux coordinate = sqrt(phi/(pi*b0)), where the toroidal magnetic field, b0, corresponds to that stored in vacuum_toroidal_field/b0 and pi can be found in the IMAS constants

disruption/profiles_1d/grid/psi.documentation: Poloidal magnetic flux. Integral of magnetic field passing through a contour defined by the intersection of a flux surface passing through the point of interest and a Z=constant plane. If the integration surface is flat, the surface normal vector is in the increasing vertical coordinate direction, Z, namely upwards.

disruption/profiles_1d/grid/volume.documentation: Volume enclosed inside the magnetic surface

disruption/profiles_1d/grid/area.documentation: Cross-sectional area of the flux surface

disruption/profiles_1d/grid/surface.documentation: Surface area of the toroidal flux surface

disruption/profiles_1d/grid/psi_magnetic.documentation: Value of the poloidal magnetic flux at the magnetic axis (useful to normalize the psi array values when the radial grid doesn't go from the magnetic axis to the plasma boundary)

disruption/profiles_1d/grid/psi_boundary.documentation: Value of the poloidal magnetic flux at the plasma boundary (useful to normalize the psi array values when the radial grid doesn't go from the magnetic axis to the plasma boundary)

disruption/profiles_1d/j_runaways.documentation: Runaways parallel current density = average(j.B) / B0, where B0 = Disruption/Vacuum_Toroidal_Field/ B0

disruption/profiles_1d/power_density_con.documentation: Power density of conductive losses to the wall (positive sign for losses)

disruption/profiles_1d/power_density_rad.documentation: Power density of radiative losses (positive sign for losses)

disruption/vacuum_toroidal_field.documentation: Characteristics of the vacuum toroidal field (used in rho_tor definition and in the normalization of current densities)

disruption/vacuum_toroidal_field/r0.documentation: Reference major radius where the vacuum toroidal magnetic field is given (usually a fixed position such as the middle of the vessel at the equatorial midplane)

disruption/vacuum_toroidal_field/b0.documentation: Vacuum toroidal field at R0 [T]; Positive sign means anti-clockwise when viewing from above. The product R0B0 must be consistent with the b_tor_vacuum_r field of the tf IDS.
